name: ShowPlayerDialog
notes: It is recommended to use enumerations (see above) or definitions (#define) to determine which IDs dialogs have, to avoid confusion in the future. You should never use literal numbers for IDs - it gets confusing.
versions: This function was added in SA-MP 0.3a and will not work in earlier versions!
tips:
Use color embedding for multiple colors in the text.
 Using -1 as dialogid closes all dialogs currently shown on the client's screen.
description: Shows the player a synchronous (only one at a time) dialog box.
params_title: (playerid, dialogid, style, caption[], info[], button1[], button2[])

params_body.name: playerid
params_body.description: The ID of the player to show the dialog to.

params_body.name: dialogid
params_body.description: An ID to assign this dialog to, so responses can be processed. Max dialogid is 32767. Using negative values will close any open dialog.

params_body.name: caption[]
params_body.description: The title at the top of the dialog. The length of the caption can not exceed more than 64 characters before it starts to cut off.

params_body.name: info[]
params_body.description: The text to display in the main dialog. Use \n to start a new line and \t to tabulate.

params_body.name: button1[]
params_body.description: The text on the left button.

params_body.name: button2[]
params_body.description: The text on the right button. Leave it blank ( "" ) to hide it.

return_values:
1: The function executed successfully. 

 0: The function failed to execute. This means the player is not connected.
related_fn:

 OnDialogResponse: Called when a player responds to a dialog.
